data.chText: 运动（为社会、商业或政治目的而进行的一系列有计划的活动）
data.enText: a series of planned activities that are intended to achieve a particular social, commercial or political aim

data.chText: 领导一场运动
反对在工作场所实行年龄歧视的运动
data.enText: a campaign against ageism in the workplace

data.chText: 要求议会进行改革的运动
反对吸烟的运动
警方今天开展了一场减少道路交通事故的运动。
data.enText: Today police launched (= began) a campaign to reduce road accidents.

data.chText: 一场广告宣传活动
竞选运动
总统的竞选班子 / 主管
战役
data.enText: a series of attacks and battles that are intended to achieve a particular military aim during a war

data.chText: 参加运动，领导运动（如为实现政治变革或赢得竞选胜利）
data.enText: to take part in or lead a campaign, for example to achieve political change or in order to win an election

data.chText: 我们最近15年一直参加反对捕鲸的运动。
data.enText: We have campaigned against whaling for the last 15 years.

data.chText: 该党在本国北部展开了强有力的竞选运动。
data.enText: The party campaigned vigorously in the north of the country.

data.chText: 他们正开展一场反对在这个地区进行房地产开发的运动。
data.enText: They are campaigning to save the area from building development.

data.text: campaign ♦ battle ♦ struggle ♦ drive ♦ war ♦ fight

data.chText: 以上各词均指为达到某目的或为阻止某事而作出的努力。
data.enText: These are all words for an effort made to achieve or prevent sth.

data.chText: 指为社会、商业或政治目的而进行的一系列有计划的活动或运动：
data.enText: a series of planned activities that are intended to achieve a particular social, commercial or political aim

data.chText: 要求议会改革的运动
广告宣传活动
指个人或集体为赢得权力或控制权而进行的较量、争论或斗争：
data.enText: a competition or argument between people or groups of people trying to win power or control

data.chText: 她终于赢得了这场要求赔偿的法律斗争。
data.enText: She finally won the legal battle for compensation.

data.chText: 人与大自然永无休止的斗争
data.enText: the endless battle between man and nature

data.chText: 指个人或集体为赢得权力或控制权而进行的较量、争论或斗争：
data.enText: a competition or argument between people or groups of people trying to win power or control

data.chText: 为独立的斗争
正邪之争
data.enText: the struggle between good and evil

data.chText: 用battle还是struggle？
在许多情况下，上述两词可替换使用，但struggle总是用于似乎绝对必要的斗争，如关乎生死、自由等；battle还可用于非绝对必要的斗争，如仅仅是想望或者为了获得胜利的满足感：
data.enText: In many cases you can use either word, but a struggle is always about things that seem absolutely necessary, such as life and death or freedom. A battle can also be about things that are not absolutely necessary, just desirable, or about the pleasure of winning.

data.chText: 正邪之争
data.enText: the battle/struggle between good and evil

data.chText: 指团体为达到目的而作出的有组织的努力：
data.enText: an organized effort by a group of people to achieve sth

data.chText: 为提高效率而进行的运动
为减少能源消耗而发起的运动
data.enText: a drive to reduce energy consumption

data.chText: 用campaign还是drive？
campaign通常为发动别人参加的运动；drive可指让自己作出努力：
data.enText: A campaign is usually aimed at getting other people to do sth; a drive may be an attempt by people to get themselves to do sth.

data.chText: 从今天起，我们要展开厉行节约运动。
data.enText: From today, we're going on an economy drive (= we must spend less) .

data.chText: campaign可指比drive更大规模、更正式和更有组织的活动或运动。
data.enText: A campaign may be larger, more formal and more organized than a drive .

data.chText: 指为消灭或阻止有害事物而进行的长期斗争：
data.enText: [sing.] an effort over a long period of time to get rid of or stop sth bad

data.chText: 扑灭罪行的斗争
指为制止或防止坏事物或为达到好目的而进行的斗争，或指竞赛，尤指体育竞赛：
data.enText: [sing.] the work of trying to stop or prevent sth bad or achieve sth good; an act of competing, especially in a sport

data.chText: 工人赢得了阻止强制裁员的斗争。
data.enText: Workers won their fight to stop compulsory redundancies.

data.chText: 用war还是fight？
war用于制止人人摒弃的事物（如毒品和犯罪）而进行的斗争；fight可用于为自己伸张正义而进行的斗争。
data.enText: A war is about stopping things, like drugs and crime, that everyone agrees are bad. A fight can be about achieving justice for yourself.
to launch/mount/start/lead/be engaged in/carry on/keep up a campaign/battle/struggle/drive/war/fight

simple_means.memory_skill: camp 田野 + aign → 营地 → 战役

means: 运动(为社会、商业或政治目的而进行的一系列有计划的活动)
参加运动，领导运动(如为实现政治变革或赢得竞选胜利)

ex.chText: 他论文的第一段介绍了女权运动的历史。
ex.enText: The first paragraph of his paper was about the history of the feminist movement.

ex.chText: 她领导了一个禁止在公共场所吸烟的运动。
ex.enText: She led a movement to stop smoking in public places.

synonyms.bx: 多指政治、社会等方面的运动。

ex.chText: 他在筹集宣传活动经费方面遇到了困难。
ex.enText: He met difficulties in raising campaign funds.

ex.chText: 这个广告宣传活动耗资多少？
ex.enText: How much does the advertising campaign cost?

synonyms.bx: 指为了取得某种结果而进行的政治、社会或商业性的运动，多指竞选、广告等宣传活动。

ex.chText: 他们进行了一场为妇女争取权利的运动。
ex.enText: They ran a crusade for women's rights.

ex.chText: 许多市民支持反吸烟运动。
ex.enText: Many citizens support the crusade against smoking.

synonyms.bx: 指基于道义方面的考虑而决意改变某事的运动。

ex.chText: 招募新成员的运动奏效了，该组织收到了80多份申请。
ex.enText: The recruitment drive for new members worked, as the organization has received more than 80 applications.

ex.chText: 将有一场打击犯罪的全国性运动。
ex.enText: There's going to be a nationwide drive to crack down on crime.

synonyms.bx: 尤指为某一目的而作出的有组织的努力。

ex.zh: 为反对某人/某事开展活动

tr: an overland journey by hunters (especially in Africa)
a series of actions advancing a principle or tending toward a particular end
example: they worked in the cause of world peace
the team was ready for a drive toward the pennant

tr: several related operations aimed at achieving a particular goal (usually within geographical and temporal constraints)
a race between candidates for elective office
example: I managed his campaign for governor
he is raising money for a Senate run

tr: run, stand, or compete for an office or a position
example: Who's running for treasurer this year?

tr: exert oneself continuously, vigorously, or obtrusively to gain an end or engage in a crusade for a certain cause or person
example: The liberal party pushed for reforms
She is crusading for women's rights
The Dean is pushing for his favorite candidate

value.def: A campaign is a planned set of activities that people carry out over a period of time in order to achieve something such as social or political change.

example.ex: During his election campaign he promised to put the economy back on its feet...
example.tran: 他在竞选时许诺将重振经济。

example.ex: Apacs has launched a campaign to improve the training of staff.
example.tran: 雅拍体育用品公司开展了加强员工培训的活动。
反对在公共场所吸烟的运动

value.def: If someone campaigns for something, they carry out a planned set of activities over a period of time in order to achieve their aim.

example.ex: We are campaigning for law reform...
example.tran: 我们正在宣传呼吁进行法律改革。

example.ex: Mr Burns has actively campaigned against a hostel being set up here...
example.tran: 伯恩斯先生积极活动,反对在这儿建青年旅舍。

example.ex: They have been campaigning to improve the legal status of women.
example.tran: 他们一直在为提高妇女的法律地位而奔走呼号。

value.def: In a war, a campaign is a series of planned movements carried out by armed forces.

example.ex: The allies are intensifying their air campaign.
example.tran: 联军部队正加大他们的空战强度。

trans: 战斗模式；战役模式；运动模式；任务模式
竞选活动；政治运动；政治竞选活动；竞选；竞选运动
促销运动；大的促销活动
(指大规模集中进行的)广告战，广告宣传活动

partsOfSpeech.d: 营地（营地一般都在野外）

partsOfSpeech.dec: camp 田野 + aign → 营地 → 战役
camp 田野 + us 表名词，用于科学术语 → 校园
en 进入…之中 + camp 营地 → 宿营
